name: Chicken Curry with Mustard Seeds
title: Chicken Curry with Mustard Seeds
imageAltText: Chicken curry served in a bowl with coriander
instructions: Melt butter and oil in a pan
Dice the onion. Fry in the pan slowly (20 minutes) until golden brown.
Add chopped chilli and garlic cloves to the onions and cook for a few minutes.
Brown skinned chicken pieces in a separate pan.
Add cumin, turmeric and garam masala / madras powder to onions. Add the chopped peppers too. Cook for a few minutes.
Add chicken stock to the onion mix (the amount needed should eventually cover the onions and chicken pieces). Bring it to boil.
Add a squeeze of tomato puree, salt and pepper to taste. Add the chicken bits. Add a cinommon stick and bay leaf.
Cover with a lid and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Make sure it doesn't boil dry: it should thicken up.
When the meat is cooked, take it out and allow the sauce to continue thickening. Once that is done, pour over the chicken bits.
In a separate pan, heat up some oil and add seeds until they start popping / smoking (this doesn't take long).
Pour the seeds over the curry.
Serve with rice and chutney or minty yoghurt.
